revised_title: On the Microscopic Structure and Action of Test-Objects on Transmitted Light
tldr: The author examines the structure of microscopic test-objects, such as the scales of Podura plumbea and the valves of Pleurosigma, and their effects on transmitted light. The study focuses on the relationship between the structure of these objects and their ability to test the defining power and separating power of an object-glass. The author also discusses the optimal techniques for illuminating and viewing these objects.
